page.title: 07Tarme fer go wom
page.content: Fost ar 'ave fer find me tranklements an' then ar skidaddle across th' plee-grind.Ar tak th' road dine th' bonk an ' go rind th' backsies.Afore lung ar'm wom.Ar'm clemmed an'conna weet fer me snappin.Sometarmes wey' ave oatcakes laubed with cheyse.Ar reyly larkes theyse.Then ar go ite plee or lozark in th' arm-cheer watching tally. TRANSLATION. Time to go home. First I have to find my things and then I hurry off across the playground.I take the road down the bank and go round the back streets.Before long I am home.I am hungry and cannot wait for my food.Sometimes we have oatcakes thickly covered with cheese.I really like these.Then I go out to play or laze in the arm-chair watching television.
